THE FRIENDLY INN SUPPORTS ORGANIZATIONS PROVIDING FOOD, SHELTER, CLOTHING AND OTHER LIFE-ESSENTIALS TO THE POOR, NEEDY AND DISADVANTAGED. SEVERAL OF THESE ORGANIZATIONS HAVE BEEN HISTORICALLY SUPPORTED OVER THE COURSE OF MANY YEARS. OTHERS ARE ORGANIZATIONS BROUGHT TO OUR ATTENTION MORE RECENTLY.

THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, UNDER THE AUTHORITY GRANTED BY THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, APPROVED THE ADDITION OF ONE NEW ORGANIZATION (H.O.P.E.). THE MISSION OF THIS ORGANIZATION MEETS THE CRITERIA FOR SUPPORT AS DEFINED IN FRIENDLY INN'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS.

JOHN H. WEST, III, THE PRESIDENT OF THE FRIENDLY INN, IS ALSO A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE KESWICK FOUNDATION. KESWICK HAS BEEN AN ORGANIZATION WHICH HAS BEEN SUPPORTED CONTINUOUSLY BY THE FRIENDLY INN SINCE THE EARLY YEARS OF THE 20TH CENTURY WHEN IT WAS FORMERLY CALLED "THE HOME FOR INCURABLES IN BALTIMORE CITY." THE FRIENDLY INN ORGANIZATIONAL DOCUMENTS DESIGNATE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS BY PURPOSE AND THE BOARD MAINTAINS A CLOSE AND CONTINUOUS WORKING RELATIONSHIP WITH THOSE ORGANIZATIONS, MOST FUNDED FOR MANY YEARS. THESE CHARITIES SUBMIT GRANT REQUESTS TO THE ORGANIZATION AND HAVE A SIGNIFICANT VOICE IN THE TIMING OF GRANTS, MANNER OF MAKING THE GRANTS, THE SELECTION OF GRANT RECIPIENTS AND USE OF INCOME AND ASSETS BY VIRTUE OF THEIR GRANT PRESENTATIONS AND INPUT ON COMMUNITY AND ORGANIZATIONAL NEEDS. THE FRIENDLY INN BOARD MEMBERS HAVE PERSONAL CONTACT WITH SENIOR MANAGEMENT OF THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS ON AN ONGOING BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AFTER GRANT AWARDS ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD AND GRANT FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE VARIOUS GRANTEES, BOARD MEMBERS HAVE PERSONAL CONTACT OR MAKE PERSONAL VISITS TO THE VARIOUS ENTITIES ON A PERIODIC BASIS TO MAKE INQUIRIES ABOUT THE USE OF THE GRANT FUNDS.
JOHN H. WEST, III MOLLIE NEBLETT PRESIDENT DIRECTOR FAMILY (BROTHER AND SISTER) JOHN H. WEST, III JAMES H. WEST PRESIDENT SECRETARY FAMILY (FATHER AND SON)
THERE ARE NO COMMITTEES THAT HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNING BODY (THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS). WRITTEN MINUTES ARE TAKEN AT BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETINGS.
A COPY OF THE DRAFT FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD MEMBERS FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT PRIOR TO FILING.
EACH BOARD MEMBER IS REQUIRED TO REVIEW AND SIGN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE FORM ANNUALLY.
SUCH DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
